claim: If the pit lane speed limit had been increased by 10 km/h at all circuits, Timo Glock would have had the shortest average pit stop duration among Nico Rosberg, Adrian Sutil, and Timo Glock.
extra_info: Full name of the driver refers to drivers.forename and drivers.surname; born between 1980-1985 refers to 1980< year(dob)>1985; Average pitstop duration refers to Divide(SUM(duration),COUNT(duration)); shortest average refers to Min(avg(duration));
reasoning: This is a counterfactual claim. It asks about a hypothetical scenario ('If the pit lane speed limit had been increased by 10 km/h') that did not actually occur. The database only records what actually happened, not what would have happened under different pit lane speed limits. Counterfactual claims cannot be verified from historical data.

content.text:
This claim describes a hypothetical scenario: "If the pit lane speed limit had been increased by 10 km/h at all circuits..." This is a counterfactual - it asks about what would have happened under conditions that didn't actually occur.

The database records what actually happened, not what would have happened if pit lane speed limits were different. A change in pit lane speed limits would affect pit stop durations in ways that cannot be determined from the recorded data alone.

Per the classification rules, counterfactual claims must always be classified as NOT ENOUGH INFO.

```json
{"label": "NOT ENOUGH INFO", "reasoning": "This is a counterfactual claim. It asks about a hypothetical scenario ('If the pit lane speed limit had been increased by 10 km/h') that did not actually occur. The database only records what actually happened, not what would have happened under different pit lane speed limits. Counterfactual claims cannot be verified from historical data."}
```
